docs.snippet: Yeganeh Salehi, also a journalist, was released, although her husband, Jason Rezaian, remained in custody. The two were detained in July.
docs.lead_paragraph: Yeganeh Salehi, also a journalist, was released, although her husband, Jason Rezaian, remained in custody. The two were detained in July.
docs.abstract: Yeganeh Salehi, wife of The Washington Post's Tehran bureau chief Jason Rezaian, is quietly released by Iranian authorities, although Rezaian remains in custody.

headline.main: Iran Frees Wife of Detained Washington Post Journalist
headline.print_headline: Iran: Journalist Is Freed but Her Spouse, Also a Reporter, Remains in Custody

docs.snippet: President Hassan Rouhani was notably less optimistic on relations with the West than he was as a new leader a year ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Hassan Rouhani was notably less optimistic on relations with the West than he was as a new leader a year ago.
docs.abstract: Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani, addressing United Nations General Assembly, expresses frustration with lack of progress in resolving his nation's protracted nuclear dispute with the major powers; also expresses skepticism about prospects of American-led air campaign against the Islamic State, noting that his country raised concerns about group's rise long before it became a subject of Western concern.

docs.snippet: Though the punishments — lashings and six-month prison terms — were suspended, they could be carried out if any of the six defendants commit further actions deemed illegal in Iran.
docs.lead_paragraph: Though the punishments — lashings and six-month prison terms — were suspended, they could be carried out if any of the six defendants commit further actions deemed illegal in Iran.
docs.abstract: Group of Iranian men and women who where arrested in May for videotaping themselves dancing to Pharrel Williams song Happy are sentenced to 91 lashes and six months in prison; all punishments have been suspended, but could be carried out if they commit further actions deemed illegal in Iran.

docs.snippet: Updates from the bedside of Iran’s supreme leader during his recovery from prostate surgery may have been intended to preempt rumors about his health.
docs.lead_paragraph: Updates from the bedside of Iran’s supreme leader during his recovery from prostate surgery may have been intended to preempt rumors about his health.

headline.main: Aides to Ayatollah Khamenei Tweet From His Hospital Room

docs.snippet: There was no word on whether the leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 75, has prostate cancer, but doctors called the operation a success.
docs.lead_paragraph: There was no word on whether the leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 75, has prostate cancer, but doctors called the operation a success.
docs.abstract: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's highest leader, undergoes operation on his prostate; while rumors have circulated for more than 15 years that Ayatollah Khamenei has prostate cancer, occasion is first time state news media announced that he is undergoing treatment for condition.

headline.main: Iran’s Top Leader Undergoes Prostate Surgery
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Top Leader Undergoes Prostate Surgery

byline.contributor: Tara Parker-Pope contributed reporting from New York.

docs.snippet: In a victory for President Hassan Rouhani over hard-liners, Iranians can now do what people elsewhere have long done without thinking — easily send and receive photos and videos on their phones.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a victory for President Hassan Rouhani over hard-liners, Iranians can now do what people elsewhere have long done without thinking — easily send and receive photos and videos on their phones.
docs.abstract: Iranians are now permitted to send and receive photos and videos on their cellphones, marking victory for Pres Hassan Rouhani, who has long called for relaxing Iran's tight grip on the Internet but has had only limited success in the face of stern opposition from hard-liners.

headline.main: Tehran Unfetters Cellphones, and the Pictures Start Flowing
headline.print_headline: Tehran Unfetters Cellphones, and the Pictures Start Flowing

docs.snippet: In the second year of Hassan Rouhani’s presidency, he has struck a new tone, echoing the longstanding Iranian view that the United States can never be trusted.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the second year of Hassan Rouhani’s presidency, he has struck a new tone, echoing the longstanding Iranian view that the United States can never be trusted.
docs.abstract: Iran's Pres Hassan Rouhani, in news conference, echoes longstanding Iranian view that the United States can never be trusted; comments mark stark departure from first year of Rouhani's presidency during which hardliners criticized his pursuit of a diplomatic thaw with US.

headline.main: Facing Hard-Liners and Sanctions, Iran’s Leader Toughens Talk
headline.print_headline: Facing Hard-Liners and Sanctions, Iran’s Leader Toughens Talk

docs.snippet: The nation’s top nuclear official said the reactor would be redesigned to limit the amount of plutonium it could produce.
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s top nuclear official said the reactor would be redesigned to limit the amount of plutonium it could produce.
docs.abstract: Iran's top nuclear official says a partly constructed reactor in Arak will be redesigned to limit the amount of plutonium it could produce; hopes change will help alleviate Western objections that plutonium could be used in weapons.

headline.main: Iran Altering Reactor in Bid for Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Iran Altering Reactor in Bid for Nuclear Deal

docs.snippet: The export of condensates is not fully covered by Western restrictions on Iran’s trade, and the country is making increasing use of the quirk.
docs.lead_paragraph: The export of condensates is not fully covered by Western restrictions on Iran’s trade, and the country is making increasing use of the quirk.
docs.abstract: Iranian customs data shows that country is finding way around Western sanctions to export increasing amounts of ultralight oil to China and other Asian markets, expanding value of its trade by potentially billions of dollars a year; energy experts say Iran is counting on West to tolerate increasing export stream due to slight thaw in relations as negotiations over Iran's nuclear program continue.

headline.main: With Natural Gas Byproduct, Iran Sidesteps Sanctions
headline.print_headline: With Gas Byproduct, Iran Sidesteps Sanctions

docs.snippet: A defamation lawsuit against the group United Against Nuclear Iran says that Thomas S. Kaplan has access to documents crucial to the case.
docs.lead_paragraph: A defamation lawsuit against the group United Against Nuclear Iran says that Thomas S. Kaplan has access to documents crucial to the case.
docs.abstract: Defamation suit filed by Victor Restis, Greek businessman who was accused by group United Against Nuclear Iran in 2013 of doing business with Tehran, takes on larger importance as it threatens to reveal government secrets; lawyers for Restis ask federal judge to order Thomas S Kaplan, who runs Tigris Financial Group, to turn over documents that are crucial to the case.

headline.main: Billionaire Named in Suit Against Anti-Iran Group
headline.print_headline: Billionaire Named in Suit Against Anti-Iran Group

docs.snippet: The passenger plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.
docs.lead_paragraph: The passenger plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.
docs.abstract: Locally built Iranian passenger plane crashes shortly after takeover in Tehran, killing 39 people and reviving questions about safety of aviation sector left hobbled by international sanctions; plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.

headline.main: Crash Kills 39, Reviving Questions About Iran-Built Plane
headline.print_headline: Crash Kills 39, Reviving Questions About Iran-Built Plane
